topic.title: Getting Started
topic.shortdesc: There are several ways to use Incanter.

body.p: To use Incanter you must understand the basics of Clojure. Since there are many tutorials and guides available on the web for Clojure beginners we will not cover Clojure basics here.
There are several ways to use Incanter:

ul.li: Executables are available for the Mac OS X, Windows, and Java platforms. Executables can be started by double-clicking on the file, so this is probably the easiest way to get started. The drawback is that everything is stuffed into a single file, so you won't have local access to data, documentation, and examples.

The "prebuilt distribution" is a deployable bundle of directories containing everything you need to run Incanter. Download and unpack/unzip it, and you will end up with a structure including the following directories:
data contains a set of data files you can use to explore Incanter's capabilities
docs contains a formatted cheatsheet
examples contains some code samples
lib contains the Java jar files upon which Incanter depends
modules contains the Clojure source for Incanter (more on these below)
script contains some convenience shell scripts
